comments.body: This is what was causing tests that launch subprocesses to fail (e.g. the CLI tests that we marked with `pytest.mark.notrackingurimock`). The specific problem is that we'd set the tracking URI, but not set the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI environment variable, so subprocesses would not run with our mock tracking URI (& instead would actually log to whatever the user's default tracking URI was, usually ./mlruns within the current directory).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@                os.path.join(tmpdir.strpath, 'mlruns'))
            mlflow.set_tracking_uri(tracking_uri)
            os.environ["MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI"] = tracking_uri
        yield tmpdir
    finally:
